content: page 1 of 7 this is a very basic top-down sock pattern written with explanatory detail for the boxing day socks pattern beginning sock knitter who is just learning or is still learning to become confident in by kiersten harrod sock knitting techniques the simple ribbing pattern is very stretchy and therefore very forgiving when it comes to matching the width of the sock to the foot and lower leg of the intended wearer materials used one skein 1918 yarn company fox sock in old photographs 437 yards fingering weight or two balls knit picks stroll in blue steel heather 462 yards fingering weight us size 1 needles tapestry needle techniques used long tail cast on knit and purl stitches k2tog knit 2 together and ssk slip slip knit short row description included kitchener stitch description included picking up stitches knitting in the round instructions holding two needles together for thickness and using the long tail cast on method video demo link at end cast on 73 stitches arrange your stitches to work in the round using magic loop video demo link at end and move the first cast on stitch to the needle next to the last cast on stitch you will work those two stitches together as one at the end of the first round for a seamless join and have a total of 72 stitches after the first round © 2025 kiersten harrod all rights reserved go to www kierstenj com for more resources to help you be a better knitter page 2 of 7 leg purl 1 knit 2 purl 2 knit 2 to last stitch purl 1 work in this pattern known as k2 p2 ribbing every round until the piece called the leg is the desired length at least 6 inches heel flap you will work with only half of the stitches 36 while making the heel flap working back and forth rather than in the round the other half of the stitches will rest on the cable part of the circular needle while you re working back and forth on the heel flap a slip the first stitch from the left to the right needle with the yarn in front as if you were going to purl but do not purl knit and purl the next 35 stitches in pattern k2 p2 in other words knit the knits and purl the purls remember knits look like vs and purls look like bumps b turn the sock so you re facing the wrong side inside of the heel slip the first stitch from the left to the right needle with the yarn in back as if you were going to knit but do not knit purl and knit the next 35 stitches in pattern p2 k2 purling the purl bumps and knitting the knit vs turn the sock so the right ride outside is facing you and repeat a then repeat b you will work a and b a total of 15 times each
